Democracy (for Jews)

This is an important point that is very rarely made in the media. In this 2000 interview, Phyllis Bennis, head of the Middle East Project at the Institute for Policy Studies in Washington, D.C., points out the racism inherent in the way Israeli democracy is run. May 30, 2002

China: Amnesty International Report 2002

AI reports that 2,4468 people were executed in China’s crackdown on crime. This was reported earlier in the NY Times, but has received surprisingly little attention. By labeling these people as “criminals” China seems to have avoided the kinds of attacks they receive when they jail “activists” … they even got admitted into the WTO. “Serious ...

May 30, 2002

Carpet Weaving Throws Lifeline to Refugees

“The carpet industry, a major source of income for Afghan refugees in Pakistan, illustrates the dilemma facing Human Rights activists who want to eradicate child labour: the money the youngsters make is the difference between their families getting by or plunging deeper into poverty.” (Afgha.com)
